macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US major indices advanced on Dec. 19 after cooler CPI and mixed earnings
items.summary: The Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq and Russell 2000 all closed higher on Dec. 19, with Nasdaq leading gains after cooler CPI data and some positive corporate reports; technology, health care and energy outperformed while consumer staples and real estate lagged in intraday action.[1]

items.title: Weekly recap: Big Tech weakness drove indices lower over the week
items.summary: Over the week ending Dec. 19 the S&P 500 fell about 2% and the Nasdaq and Russell 2000 declined nearly 3% as weakness was concentrated in mega-cap tech and AI-related stocks, while value and defensive sectors outperformed and Treasury yields drifted lower.[2]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Binance market update: mixed trading, BTC steady near $88k
items.summary: Binance reports most large-cap cryptocurrencies traded mixed over the past 24 hours while Bitcoin traded in an $86.8k–$89.4k range and was near $88.3k, with global crypto market cap about $2.98T and select small-cap tokens outperforming (SOPH, GIGGLE, ANIME).

items.title: Crypto market livestream commentary: technical market analysis
items.summary: A live market-analysis stream (Candle King) provided real-time chart and trading commentary for December 20, focusing on price action and trading education rather than breaking fundamental news.

items.title: Institutional adoption theme: Bitcoin as yield-generating asset
items.summary: Fintech Weekly highlights institutional interest in using Bitcoin to generate yield via regulated lending, collateralized strategies and arbitrage, arguing these developments shift Bitcoin’s role from pure store-of-value toward productive capital for portfolios.

items.title: Market commentary: bullish forecasts and liquidity outlook for 2026
items.summary: Crypto news roundups (e.g., 99Bitcoins) and market commentators point to improving liquidity and bullish predictions for Bitcoin and broader crypto into 2026, suggesting potential for new highs if macro and liquidity conditions continue to improve.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Humanoid robotics and AI capabilities surge in 2025 — broad YouTube roundup
items.summary: A widely viewed YouTube episode summarized rapid 2025 advances in humanoid robots, including cheaper, faster platforms, increased real-world deployment, and research linking simulation-to-real training (ASAP) for agile movement, highlighting risks around autonomous weapons and public deployments.

items.title: Nabla announces strategic partnership with Yann LeCun’s new research company
items.summary: Nabla said it forged an exclusive strategic partnership with Advanced Machine Intelligence, a company founded by Yann LeCun, to gain early access to 'world model' technologies for building agentic, FDA-certifiable clinical AI systems designed to improve deterministic reasoning and handling of continuous medical signals.

items.title: Unified dynamics paper links cosmology, biology and machine learning
items.summary: Researchers from IIT Roorkee published a theoretical framework proposing common dynamical principles across the Big Bang, biological evolution, and machine learning, presenting mathematical motifs for complexity and adaptation and releasing a preprint on arXiv.

items.title: AI reshapes cybersecurity: defenders and attackers both gain new capabilities
items.summary: A 2025 industry overview reports AI is accelerating threat detection and response while enabling more automated attacks—AI-generated phishing, deepfakes and supply-chain compromises are increasingly common—prompting expanded training and credential programs to upskill cybersecurity workforces.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: U.S. Department of Energy launches ‘Genesis’ research collaboration with big tech and startups
items.summary: The DOE announced a major research mission joining government, large technology firms and smaller companies to accelerate energy and scientific computing projects—partnering with firms across cloud, hardware and software to support DOE facilities and research programs.

items.title: Netflix acquires avatar-maker Ready Player Me to boost cross-platform experiences
items.summary: Netflix agreed to acquire Ready Player Me, a maker of interoperable 3D avatars and avatar-creation tools, to expand its capabilities in gaming and social/interactive experiences across devices and platforms.

items.title: Google reports strong ‘boomerang’ hiring trend for engineering roles
items.summary: Google said a notable share of hires this year have been returning former employees—part of broader tech-sector hiring patterns as companies rehire experienced talent to accelerate product work.

items.title: Russian-linked Microsoft 365 phishing campaign targets enterprise users
items.summary: Security researchers disclosed a phishing campaign attributed to Russia-linked actors that abuses Microsoft 365 workflows to harvest credentials and bypass protections, prompting fresh guidance for enterprise admins.
items.source: The Hacker News (reported in news roundups)

items.title: Netflix push into gaming and social avatars signals broader media–tech convergence
items.summary: Industry coverage highlights Netflix’s Ready Player Me purchase as part of a wider strategy by media companies to integrate real-time 3D, avatars and interactive features into streaming and games to increase engagement.
items.source: Tech industry coverage (summarized from multiple outlets)

items.title: Research reports spotlight growth areas: intelligent shopping carts and payment gateways
items.summary: Market research releases highlighted opportunities in retail tech—intelligent shopping carts—and an $86.9 billion opportunity in payment gateways driven by BNPL, mobile wallets and blockchain integrations.
items.source: Research and Markets / GlobeNewswire (via newswire summaries)

items.title: Entertainment production company Asteria emphasizes ethical, permission-based AI video tools
items.summary: Asteria and partners promoted a film-focused AI video tool that uses only open-license or explicitly permitted source material, positioning ethical sourcing as a selling point amid copyright controversies in generative video.
